description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Freshman English for Non-English Majors (Higher-Intermediate, Fall 2018)**

**10:20-12:10, Friday**

Instructor: Hsu Hsiao-Ling
--------------------------

Email: [hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw)
----------------------------------------------------

Office: Common Core Education Committee, 3rd floor of Administrative Building

Office Hours: By appointment (Monday 13:00~15:00; Friday 15:00~17:00)

**Course Description:**

This course is designed to support students in their use of English language in academic context. Through intensive and extended reading of text materials, engagement in production activities, and practice at the Self-Learning Center, students are expected to acquire communication strategies for reading, listening, speaking, and writing, develop fluency and autonomy, and improve their critical thinking skills.

**Textbook**:

Daise, D., Norloff, C., & Carne, P. (2015). _Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, 4._ (Second edition) New York: Oxford University Press.

(Available at 師大書苑; 02-83695556~8;台北市和平東路1段182-3號2樓)

**Articles for required reading:**

Unit 1: Reading 1: We all need a role model

Unit 2: Reading 1: So much dead space

Unit 3: Reading 1: The good teen

Unit 4: Reading 1: Two styles of writing

**Grading Policy:**

Attendance & Participation                                                   10%

Comprehension check\*4                                                                20%

Extensive reading                                                                   10%

Language exchange presentation                                           10%

Discussion\*4                                                                         20%

Assignments\*6                                                                       30%

**Extensive reading**

1.  Go to library on Oct. 5th and explore books in the Lexile section (2nd floor).
2.  Decide your three favorite topics. (can be adjusted later)
3.  Based on your Lexile scores (test on Oct. 12th or 15th), read five + two books of your own selection.
    1.  If you score 500 points in the Lexile test, you can only select books ranging from 400~550 points.
    2.  You have to complete five books in this semester and upload required assignments to the Moodle. The other two books are for your reading in the winter break.
    3.  Assignments: Complete a story map (downloadable from the Moodle) for each of your book selection.
